title: Navy Won’t Close Hawaii Jet-Fuel Facility That Leaked into Locals’ Drinking Water
sub_head: Task force of government officials to seek other ways to address causes of contamination that has displaced 3,000 people
body:
WASHINGTON—A U.S. Navy committee tasked with addressing a leak of jet fuel from a World War II-era storage facility that contaminated the water supply on a base in Hawaii won’t consider closing the site, a Navy official said.
Navy Secretary Carlos Del Toro established a task force on Dec. 8 consisting of officials from across the government to fix the causes of the leak and ensure clean drinking water and safe operations at Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility on Hawaii’s Oahu island near Honolulu, according to a memo viewed by The Wall Street Journal.
